intro: Carex rouyana, commonly known as the slender sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like foliage and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes. Native to wetland and marshy environments, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
